content: Do alcoholic beverages make your entire body warmer?

Yes, alcoholic beverages can make you feel warmer, but this is a deceptive sensation. When you drink alcohol, it causes blood vessels near the surface of your skin to dilate, which increases blood flow to the skin's surface. This dilation makes you feel warmer because more heat is being released through your skin. However, this also means that your body is actually losing heat more rapidly, which can be dangerous in cold environments as it may lead to hypothermia. So, while alcohol might make you feel warmer, it's not actually increasing your core body temperature; instead, it's making you lose heat faster.
